MassKitUtils 2.4.0

  • Changelog

Export data to Excel file with formatting options

export_to_excel.Rd

This function exports data frames to Excel files with comprehensive formatting options including header styles, table styles, and customizable colors and fonts.

export_to_excel(
  data,
  filename,
  sheet_name = "Data",
  header_style = "default",
  table_style = "default",
  header_bg_color = "#D3D3D3",
  header_font_color = "#000000",
  border_color = "#000000",
  font_size = 11,
  auto_width = TRUE,
  freeze_pane = TRUE,
  add_summary = FALSE,
  format_table = TRUE,
  quiet = FALSE
)

Arguments

data

Data frame to export

filename

Character string for the output file name

sheet_name

Character string for the worksheet name (default: "Data")

header_style

Character string for header style. Options:

  • "default" - Gray background, centered, bold

  • "bold" - Bold text only

  • "colored" - Blue background, white text, centered

  • "minimal" - Bold text only

table_style

Character string for table style. Options:

  • "default" - Top and bottom borders

  • "bordered" - Full borders on all cells

  • "striped" - Alternating row colors

  • "minimal" - No borders

header_bg_color

Character string for header background color (hex code)

header_font_color

Character string for header font color (hex code)

border_color

Character string for border color (hex code)

font_size

Numeric value for font size

auto_width

Logical, whether to auto-adjust column widths (default: TRUE)

freeze_pane

Logical, whether to freeze the first row (default: TRUE)

add_summary

Logical, whether to add summary statistics (default: FALSE)

format_table

Logical, whether to apply table formatting (default: TRUE)

quiet

Logical, whether to suppress messages (default: FALSE)

Value

Invisible NULL

Details

This function requires the openxlsx package to be installed. If the package is not available, the function will stop with an error message.

The function automatically creates output directories if they don't exist and provides comprehensive error handling for various failure scenarios.

See also

ensure_packages, setup_analysis_structure

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Basic usage
export_to_excel(mtcars, "cars.xlsx")

# With custom styling
export_to_excel(mtcars, "cars_styled.xlsx", 
               header_style = "colored", 
               table_style = "striped")

# With summary sheet
export_to_excel(mtcars, "cars_with_summary.xlsx",
               add_summary = TRUE)
} # }
